item.title: China’s Luckin Coffee Prepares To Relist Shares In US – Can It Brew Fresh Competition For Starbucks?
item.description: Luckin was delisted from the Nasdaq in 2020 after the company overreported its revenue, resulting in a regulatory fine.

item.title: Oklo Advances Nuclear Plans With DOE Approval Amid Mounting Losses
item.description: The company reported a net loss of $0.20 per share, compared with a loss of $0.08 per share a year earlier.

item.title: Marvell Stock Rises In Premarket After 4% Drop; Retail Traders Speculate A SoftBank Takeover
item.description: The recent AI sell-off has not spared Marvell shares, making the valuation of the chipmaker even more attractive.

item.title: Roger Federer-Backed On Holdings Lifts 2025 Sales Outlook Amid Surging Demand For Its Shoes
item.description: The company’s third-quarter net sales rose 24.9% to CHF 794.4 million, compared with Wall Street estimates of CHF 763.8 million, according to data com...

item.title: TotalEnergies To Power Google’s Ohio Data Centers With Solar Energy
item.description: The deal comes as U.S. data centers face a surge in power demand driven by AI infrastructure growth.
